- Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment

- Topic: Appeal of Vieux Carré Commission's Decision
- Summary: The council discussed an appeal by Lambert & Lambert, a law corporation on behalf of Mercier Realty & Investment Co., regarding the denial to install new wood framing and stucco at the rear enclosure for the properties located at 532-534 N. Rampart Street by the Vieux Carré Commission.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Zoning Docket Numbers and Street Name Change Considerations
- Summary: The ordinance transmitted various zoning docket numbers and street name change considerations to the City Planning Commission. It included recommendations for approval, modification, and denial of street name changes. The hearing date was set for 11/17/22.

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Food Pop Up Vendor Host
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend and create a new temporary use category for a Food Pop Up Vendor Host within the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance. The ordinance was electronically submitted with a 90-day deadline of 12/14/22.

- Topic: Appointment to Finance Authority of New Orleans
- Summary: The motion ratified the appointment of John Milazzo, Jr. as a member of the Finance Authority of New Orleans, replacing Charles Brown. The motion was adopted.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Resolution and Order Establishing a Docket and Procedural Schedule for Entergy New Orleans, LLC's Certification of Costs Related to Hurricane Ida
- Summary: The resolution and order establish a docket and procedural schedule for Entergy New Orleans, LLC's application for certification of costs related to Hurricane Ida.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-482
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (Unanimous approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was adopted unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Entergy New Orleans, certification, Hurricane Ida, procedural schedule, costs
- UID: 2f5b0e83-8390-4775-a8e0-bdebaa7f717b

- Topic: Resolution and Order Establishing a Docket and Procedural Schedule for Entergy New Orleans, LLC's Battery Storage Demand Response Pilot Program

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Consent Agenda Item - Ordinance No. 33,898

    Vote 1: ADOPT - (Unanimous approval)

- Topic: Amendment to the Employees’ Retirement System of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to lower the retirement system funded ratio threshold to allow for cost-of-living increases or bonuses for retired members and increase the employer contribution to the retirement system. It was recommended for approval by the Governmental Affairs Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,913
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, allowing for amendments to the retirement system.
- Tags/Keywords: Retirement System, Employee Benefits, Governmental Affairs Committee
- UID: a108ed9a-1e37-4c3a-ad25-55b8c8e5da5d

- Topic: Reporting Requirements for the Department of Finance
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish reporting requirements for the Department of Finance, including the issuance of a statement with each payment the city provides to a security and improvement district, as well as an annual financial report to be transmitted to the City Council.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,893
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed as amended.
- Tags/Keywords: Department of Finance, reporting requirements, financial report
- UID: 138c2201-d37f-4fdb-92cc-6f6d513706de

- Topic: Limiting the Mayor's Power to Suspend City Code
- Summary: The ordinance aims to limit the Mayor's power to suspend Article X of Chapter 2 of the City Code. It was moved by Councilmember Morrell and adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,671
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, limiting the Mayor's power to suspend Article X of Chapter 2 of the City Code.
- UID: 5abd8424-6fce-4e74-aae7-b2f4cdc7de5f

- Topic: Prohibition of ATV Operation on Public Streets
- Summary: This ordinance aims to prohibit the operation of all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) on public streets. It was moved by Councilmember Green and continued to the meeting of 11/17/22. Speaker Michael Burnside did not speak, and the ordinance was continued.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,866
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
- UID: 5abd8424-6fce-4e74-aae7-b2f4cdc7de5f

- Topic: Prohibition of ATV Operation on Public Streets
- Summary: This ordinance, also related to the prohibition of ATV operation on public streets, was introduced by Councilmembers Giarrusso, Moreno, Green, and Thomas. It was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,885
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
- UID: 5abd8424-6fce-4e74-aae7-b2f4cdc7de5f

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for City of New Orleans
- Summary: The council considered three ordinances to amend the operating budget for the City of New Orleans for the year 2022. The first ordinance aimed to appropriate federal grant funds to the Mayor's Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness for FEMA reimbursable costs. The second ordinance also sought to appropriate federal grant funds to the same office for FEMA reimbursable costs. The third ordinance aimed to reduce the 2022 General Fund appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation to fund additional Sanitation expenses in 2022.
- Ordinance Number: 33,886; 33,899
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Deferred until later in the meeting
    - Vote 2: Deferred until later in the meeting
- Decision/Key Actions: The first two ordinances were deferred until later in the meeting, and the third ordinance was also deferred. 
- Tags/Keywords: Operating Budget, Federal Grant Funds, FEMA, Department of Police, Department of Sanitation
- UID: 2e7f92e3-b9b6-4ca7-aaf9-6c80b0342d77

- Topic: Neighborhood Meeting and Public Hearing Requirements for Bike Lane Installation
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish minimum neighborhood meeting and public hearing requirements by the Department of Public Works prior to the installation of new bike lanes.
- Ordinance Number: 33900
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with amendments, establishing requirements for public input before new bike lanes are installed.
- Tags/Keywords: Bike Lanes, Neighborhood Meetings, Public Hearing, Department of Public Works, Ordinance
- UID: a359eb78-cb75-4e8e-9de8-7c000370169e

- Topic: Prohibition of Personal Delivery Devices on Public Right-of-Way
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to prohibit personal delivery devices on the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: 33906
- Votes Summary: Not available
- Decision/Key Actions: The outcome of the vote is not provided in the summary.
- Tags/Keywords: Personal Delivery Devices, Public Right-of-Way, Traffic and Vehicles, Ordinance
- UID: a359eb78-cb75-4e8e-9de8-7c000370169e

- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget of Expenditures for the City of New Orleans for the Year 2022
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to reduce the 2022 General Fund appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation in order to fund additional Sanitation expenses in 2022.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,899
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was successfully amended and passed to reduce the 2022 General Fund appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Department of Police, Department of Sanitation, Appropriation
- UID: a61bff58-b387-4351-97e1-7d2aaf13133b

- Topic: Ordinance to establish a healthy homes program
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish a healthy homes program in the City of New Orleans, requiring the registration of rental housing properties and implementing inspections, enforcement, fees, penalties, and adjudications. The Governmental Affairs Committee recommended approval of this ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33898
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to establish a healthy homes program passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Healthy homes program, rental housing, inspections, enforcement
- UID: 7487c2b4-3edf-4f49-9bcb-2952a52db550

- Topic: Establishment of Renter Anti-Displacement Fund
- Summary: An ordinance to establish the Renter Anti-Displacement Fund as Division 48 of Article II in Section 70 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, aimed at preventing displacement of renters. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33901-29242 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Tags/Keywords: Renter Anti-Displacement Fund, prevention of displacement, City of New Orleans
- UID: 795876cb-f1d3-4f46-94e4-aed9a4955589

- Topic: Creation of new full-time staff positions for Healthy Homes ordinance
- Summary: A motion directing the Office of Code Enforcement and the Department of Safety and Permits to work on creating new full-time staff positions to administer and perform inspections pursuant to the Healthy Homes ordinance. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-486
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion directing the creation of new staff positions passed, but specific voting details were not provided.
- Tags/Keywords: Healthy Homes ordinance, staff positions, Office of Code Enforcement
- UID: 795876cb-f1d3-4f46-94e4-aed9a4955589

- Topic: Motion No. M-22-486
- Summary: Motion to direct the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for amendments to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance related to short-term rentals, in compliance with a court ruling and the city's interests in preventing nuisances, promoting affordable housing, and protecting residential character.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-486
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Add Item to Agenda - Passed (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    - Vote 3: Adopt - Passed (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion passed to direct City Planning Commission for amendments to zoning ordinance related to short-term rentals.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, short-term rentals, court ruling, affordable housing
- UID: d3d57e65-7891-4d1c-a669-7a380322909a

- Topic: Motion No. M-22-485
- Summary: Motion to direct the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for amendments to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance related to short-term rentals, in compliance with a court ruling and the city's interests in preventing nuisances, promoting affordable housing, and protecting residential character.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-485
- Votes Summary: N/A

- UID: d3d57e65-7891-4d1c-a669-7a380322909a

- Topic: Amendment to Section 90-121 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 90-121 to adjust the payment of police officers for secondary employment opportunities, private detail work, time-based jobs, and administrative fees. It also includes the addition of the Juneteenth Holiday as a specified holiday.
- Ordinance Number: 33907-29246 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: City of New Orleans, police officer pay, administrative fees, Juneteenth Holiday
- UID: 38146a9e-11ce-4709-bd8f-a428d043fae9

- Topic: Establishment of "Article XIV. — Shopping Carts" within Chapter 146 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish provisions governing the use, control, and abandonment of shopping carts within the City of New Orleans. An amendment to the ordinance was also discussed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,908
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 5 council members in favor and no opposition.
- UID: 368505a1-bd7c-4d5b-90bb-6b1bf044fbab

- Topic: Amendment to CAL. NO. 33,908 - By Councilmember Thomas
- Summary: The amendment proposed changes to the ordinance, including renumbering and clarifying certain provisions related to shopping carts.
- Ordinance Number: 33908 Amendment
- Votes Summary: Not applicable
- Decision/Key Actions: The proposed amendments were discussed but no vote outcome is provided.
- UID: 368505a1-bd7c-4d5b-90bb-6b1bf044fbab

- Topic: Amendment of Sewerage and Water Board billing dispute and appeals procedures
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and establish billing dispute and appeals procedures for the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans. It was recommended for approval by the SWBNO Billing Advisory Committee and was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
